meanings.def: to order somebody not to do something; to order that something must not be done
examples: forbid somebody (from doing something) He forbade them from mentioning the subject again.
forbid something Her father forbade the marriage.
You cannot do that. I absolutely forbid it.
forbid somebody to do something You are all forbidden to leave.
forbid somebody something My doctor has forbidden me sugar.
forbid (somebody) doing something She knew her mother would forbid her going.
I'm sorry, smoking isn't allowed./You're not allowed to smoke here.
Would you mind not talking during the music?
Could I ask you not to use your phone here, please?
I'm afraid I have to ask you not to take pictures here.

meanings.def: to make it difficult or impossible to do something
examples: Lack of space forbids further treatment of the topic here.

meanings.def: used to say that you hope that something will not happen
examples: ‘Maybe you'll end up as a lawyer, like me.’ ‘God forbid!’

idioms.def: used to say that you hope that something will not happen
examples: ‘Maybe you'll end up as a lawyer, like me.’ ‘God forbid!’
